meanings.definition: To cover or fill with crawling creatures or things.
meanings.sent1: The garden was becrawled with ants after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The forest floor was becrawled with insects of all kinds.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket was becrawled with curious ants, much to the surprise of the picnickers.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was becrawled with memories of a time long gone.
meanings.sent5: The old attic was becrawled with forgotten treasures waiting to be discovered.

meanings.definition: To move on hands and knees.
meanings.sent1: The toddler becrawled across the living room floor in search of his favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The injured hiker becrawled to safety after falling down the steep slope.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy becrawled around the yard, chasing after butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The explorer becrawled through the narrow cave entrance to uncover ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The determined soldier becrawled through the mud to reach the enemy's camp undetected.
